ISSUE.TITLE: Unable to remove existing server in ubuntu
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: After I downsized the vps server in Google Cloud Platform, the existing VPS server IP got changed where the outline server is running. When I went into Outline manager and the item under "Servers" left sidebar where Outline server from Google Cloud Platform shows non-stop spinning icon. After for few seconds, the "Server unreachable" message shows up and I tried to click "REMOVE SERVER" and it didn't work either. ![Server unreachable](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/295096/116792565-77435200-aae7-11eb-9d98-aeb8e2614b50.png) The Outline version number is 1.8.0 and I use Outline-Manager.AppImage to make it app runnable in Ubuntu. I attached both of the screenshots from Ubuntu. ![developer-tool-outline](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/295096/116792570-81fde700-aae7-11eb-9496-3be17f387397.png)

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Populate an unreachable server's view with the server id This fixes https://github.com/Jigsaw-Code/outline-server/issues/888, https://github.com/Jigsaw-Code/outline-server/issues/886, and https://github.com/Jigsaw-Code/outline-server/issues/873 which were caused by the missing id keeping us from finding the server to forget.

Populate an unreachable server's view with the server id (#890) This fixes https://github.com/Jigsaw-Code/outline-server/issues/888, https://github.com/Jigsaw-Code/outline-server/issues/886, and https://github.com/Jigsaw-Code/outline-server/issues/873 which were caused by the missing id keeping us from finding the server to forget.
